title-group.article-title: SFAS 123 And Valuation Of Employee Stock Options

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 1997 Journal of Financial Education, Jean L. Heck

abstract.p: Under Statement of Financial Accounting Standards No. 123, accounting for employee stock options, companies may continue to use the current method of accounting or elect to adopt a fair value method of accounting and recognize the cost in their financial statement If companies elect to retain the existing method of accounting, they are required to disclose the fair value of employee stock options in the notes to financial statements. This article illustrates the issues that companies are likely to encounter when they implement the Black-Scholes model to value employee stock options by using a spreadsheet.
